ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I'd recommend it. I thought the material was interesting, and the assignments very useful.

This course is critical to understanding the basis of programming languages and how they are constructed. It is a fast-paced course that I would recommend to other students who are not completely new to some of the more basic topics.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I thought it was an excellent survey - very helpful for my understanding of how people think about language design. I might have enjoyed links to influential papers for each of the topics (I'm not a graduate student in CS so I won't end up seeing those papers otherwise).

This course was the first I have taken examining anything related to the semantics of languages, and I have found it very useful. I am not sure yet how it will influence my future research, but it has changed the way I think of certain aspects of programming languages.
